header.motto: Teach me goodness, discipline, and knowledge

about: The Institute Nuestra Señora de la Asunción, is an Educational Community, founded on October 4, 1992. It is located in the Andrés Sanín neighborhood and it is the parish center of  Nuestra Señora de la Asunción, its process is developed in an unique scholar day time, serving primarily families of strata 1 and 2, from the neighborhoods Andrés Sanín, Siete de Agosto, Puerto Mallarino, Vivero and La Playa.

INSA, is a family Catholic center for formal, preschool, basic and middle school education, with an emphasis on fine arts (plastic arts and music), and in modern and classical languages (English, Spanish, French, Mandarin, Italian and Latin). It also has a solid job in the areas of systems, mathematics and ethical training.

It is a high quality private educational institution, guided by the Congregation of San Basilio, led by fathers Francisco Antonio Amico Ferrari and Rafael Ignacio Lopera Montoya, Rector and Director respectively.

"We did not want the INSA to be one more institution, like any of those that exist. The FAMILY should play a very important role in the philosophy of the Institute and we have been doing so since the beginning."
(Father Rafael Lopera, interview conducted by Luis Fernando Sánchez)

The years 1996 and 1997 were for the INSA, the years of the PEI( Institutional educational project). An investigation conducted by an expert in the field was carried out. This work was done around two questions: does the INSA respond to the reality that circumscribes it? Does the training given in the INSA, departs of the reality of its surroundings?
(Basilians in Colombia 1987 1997. Luís Fernando Sánchez. P. 68)
INSA context problems at the time of its origin: Insecurity. Management of the home economy. Conflicts and aggressiveness inside the home. Pollution of space.
(Basilians in Colombia 1987 1997. Luís Fernando Sánchez. P. 69)

content-insa.mission: Build a Catholic Educational Community, family-centered, that provides integral training to educational agents, based on its socio-cultural environment and Christian values. (PEI)
content-insa.vision: We, the members of this Educational Family, project: the construction of an integral training center for the student and his family, which enables the development of an educational community inspired by Our Lord Jesus Christ and his Gospel. May it foster in all aspects: growth, liberation, organization and participation of all its members, to live here fully in brotherhood, the Kingdom of God, now and forever. (PEI)

about: The Congregation of St. Basil is a Catholic male religious community of French origin, settled with greater force in Canada and United States. In Latin America it is present in Mexico and since 1987 in Colombia.

In our country it was first installed in the parish of Nuestra Señora de la Asunción in Cali city, by 1995 it established  its second national headquarter in the city of Medellin and at the beginning of the third millennium was founded a house destined for training in the city of Santa Fe de Bogotá.

Among the group of Basilian religious who participated in the first settlement of the community in Colombia were Father Francisco and Father Roberto and Rafael Lópera, at that time a candidate. In the last twenty-five years, Father Rafael, Father Pedro, Father Juan Carlos and Father Oscar have been ordained as priests of the Congregation of St. Basil. In addition, many men of faith have shared several years of their life with the Congregation, although they have subsequently retired, their work helped to build the Community, while this deeply permeated their Christians beings.

Today Colombia is favored with the presence of seven Basilian priests, two in the city of Cali, two in Medellín and three in the city of Bogotá, including Father Felipe Platt in the latter, along with them a significant group of candidates, postulants and scholastics advance their formation process, projecting at least two priestly ordinations in the next three years. The project of constituting a Female Community of San Basilio, with two religious and a candidate for this 2012, is added to the work of the brothers.

As for the overtaken labor, we can refer that the parishes of Cali and Medellín are articulating the work of evangelization with support for development; The dynamics of Cali promotes the Basilian charism from formal education at the Institute Nuestra Señora de la Asunción, while the Basilian being is cultivated in the Antioquia capital through popular education. The two parishes boost productive projects, although with more force in Medellín. Bogotá emphasizes the formation of people interested in entering the Congregation and pastoral collaboration is provided tangentially in the parish of Egipto and others.

In relation to the presence of the religious woman in the Congregation of San Basilio, during the last years, the Basilian Sisters have been officially constituted. This is the unique experience in the field of the Congregation at international level. Although they were born in the Basilian Parish in Medellín, they are currently located in the Parish of Nuestra Señora de la Asunción in the city of Cali, performing their work both in the educational pastoral of the INSA, as in the pastoral in the neighborhoods, especially in the formation and organization of women.
history: They were founded in France, the Annonay region, by ten diocesan priests who decided to radically live Community Life, following Jesus. Moved by the need of the time, they dedicated their efforts to teaching young people and preaching the Gospel.
Firm in their purpose, united by Common Life, they professed the vows of Chastity, Poverty and Obedience in 1822.
In the last 192 years they have been established in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Saint Lucia and Colombia.

In Colombia they have been present since 1987 in the city of Cali, Parroquia Nuestra Señora de la Asunción, in the Andrés Sanín neighborhood. Consistent with their choice, faithful to their charism for Education and Preaching, they lead the parish and the institute Nuestra Señora of the Assumption.

With the firm purpose of responding thoroughly to the reality of Colombia, the Congregation of San Basilio made its second foundation in Colombia in 1995. The second house was established in the city of Medellín, initially in the Parish in Prado Center, later in the Divino Ecce Homo Parish in the Blanquizal neighborhood, currently and definitively in the San Basilio Parish, Olaya Herrera neighborhood, where a temple was built and a pastoral process led by Father Roberto Seguín was consolidated

Aware of the importance of the education of future Basilians, in 1997 a house was established in the city of Bogotá. Although it was explored in the El Campín and July 20 neighborhoods with the Novitiate and the Scholasticate, in the year from 1999, we chose our own space called Basiliana Annonay House of Formation, in the Egypt neighborhood.

Currently, in 2014, the Congregation of Basilian Priests is organizing the House for the Novitiate in the city of Santa Martha, as a budding experience, it will surely require immense efforts, but, redundant in the future of fruits for the work of the Kingdom here on Earth, among our People.
content-basilians.our-work: From our experience and Basilian charism carry out a new evangelization that fosters life in all its senses promoting a Community in Christ that nurtures and celebrates the liberation, organization, development and participation of people to live here fully in brotherhood the Kingdom of God, now and forever.

students: The INSA wants the student to
Get to know and value himself.
Value and enjoy your family and provide solutions to family conflicts.
Be critical and sensitive to the reality around you.
Develop your personal potential and skills that allow you to insert yourself in the productive sector.
Be able to live in a community and work in a team.
Be able to make decisions in the face of needs and problems that arise.
Use an important part of your free time for self-education.
teachers: Know Jesus Christ and his Father and make him known to others.
Commit yourself to the educational work you are doing.
Be democratic, giving full opportunity in decision making.
Be accountable to the mission entrusted to you by the campus leadership as part of the IEP.
Be innovative before the new challenges of Colombian Education.
Be persistent in your work, observing day by day the educational process in each student. Providing solutions to the difficulties that may arise
Know and be sensitive to the situation that each family is experiencing.
Be aware and knowledgeable about the reality of the country.
education-levels: Our comprehensive education is based on:
Jesus Christ as the cornerstone of our project.
Educational environments enriched from the application of TIC’S.
Training in foreign languages and cultures.
Potentialization of artistic skills such as music, fine arts, etc.

approve: Approved by the Secretary of Municipal Education according to resolution No. 4143.2.21.3063 of April 23, 2009

benefits: In addition to having large and modern facilities decorated with works of art that enrich the learning environment, the institute has the following benefits:
guaranteed: It is guaranteed that during the training process the student integrally strengthens dimensions, such as:
A Catholic Christian dimension that allows you to develop a life project from the values of Christ.
Excellent training from the academic and disciplinary dimensions, where being, doing, learning and living together are strengthened.
A multicultural dimension where through the knowledge and handling of languages such as English, Latin, French, Italian and Mandarin, they discover the richness of other cultures.
An interdisciplinary dimension (teamwork) that allows enrichment from the use of information and communication technologies in areas of the regular curriculum.
Encouragement of the artistic part, especially in music through the San Basilio Philharmonic Band.

requirements: Requirements to access the admission process
1. Reside in neighborhoods bordering the campus that are located in strata 1 and 2 only.
2. For transition students the required age is 5 years old before the beginning of the school period for which they aspire.
3. Comply with each of the documents required for registration to the process.
how-to-apply: Families interested in participating in the educational project of the school must comply with the following process
step-1: Registration for an admission exam with complete documentation previously delivered personally at the Institute.
step-2: Presentation of the admission test by the student.
step-3: Participation of the family nucleus in the presentation of the Institute from the Open House program that takes place the same day of the admission exam.
step-4: Review by parents of the shortlisted list on the date established by the Institute.
step-6: Interview at the Institute with the rector or director where the quota will be officially granted.
